Question: White race
Description: GCA is much more common in whites than other ethnic groups

Question: New headache
Description: A new headache or head pain that is either recent in onset or different from previous headaches among patients with a history of chronic headache. Do not mark as present if these criteria are not fulfilled.

Question: Headache in the temporal region
Description: A new headache including the temporal region. See scalp anatomy image. A new headache or head pain that is either recent in onset or different from previous headaches among patients with a history of chronic headache.

Question: Continuous headache
Description: Headache that is present throughout the waking hours and may or may not disturb sleep

Question: Scalp tenderness
Description: Pain when touching the scalp, or with activites such as combing hair, putting on a hat or wearing glasses

Question: Continuous jaw pain
Description: Jaw pain that is present throughout the waking hours and may or may not disturb sleep

Question: Jaw claudication
Description: Pain and tiredness of the proximal jaw near the TMJ that develops after a brief period of chewing especially food requiring vigorous mastication such as steak or crusty bread, due to angina of the masseter muscle. Do not mark as present if these criteria are not fulfilled.

Question: Jaw pain which persists after chewing has ceased
options: not offer if 3005 is anwered YES

Question: Clicking/popping/grinding of jaw on jaw movement
options: We need to check the associated likelihood ratios for their numerical effect.

Question: Pain on jaw opening
Description: Pain which is felt immediately on jaw opening or with lateral movement

Question: Trismus
Description: Limitation in the ability to open the mouth

Question: Any visual disturbance
Description: check papers

Question: Any permanent loss of vison
Description: Permanent complete or partial visual loss/field defect/blindness/RAPD

Question: Unilateral permanent loss of vision
Description: Permanent complete or partial visual loss/field defect/blindness in one eye

Question: Transient loss of vision
Description: Transient vision loss lasting seconds to hours, may be monocular (amaurosis fugax), consecutive, alternating or binocular.

Question: Double vision (diplopia)
Description: Double vision that disappears when one eye is closed

Question: Cerebrovascular accident (ischaemic stroke)
Description: An acute or recent event, considered to be part of the current clinical presentation

Question: Arthralgia

Question: Myalgia
Description: Any aching of muscles (either polymyalgic or non-polymyalgic in nature)

Question: Active PMR symptoms
Description: Bilateral shoulder +/- hip girdle ache associated with morning stiffness lasting >45 minutes; passive shoulder movement > active shoulder movement

Question: Possible active PMR symptoms
Description: Bilateral shoulder +/- hip girdle ache associated with morning stiffness, but PMR definition above not fulfilled

Question: Previous PMR
Description: Previous PMR, or currently taking treatment for PMR

Question: Head and or neck pain exascerbated / reproduced with neck movements
Spurlings manouvre reproduces temporal region pain
Description: Spurlings manouvre is a test for cervical radicular pain, including cervicogenic headache. Headache usually parieto/temporal radiating from the occiput and neck is reproduced with neck extension and lateral flexion of the neck to the side of the pain +/- axial compression.
